content: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I believe currently in Ethereum, in order to verify the signature you actually have to unpack the RLP encoded transaction, remove the signature, and then re-pack into RLP without the signature.

author: sky.cactus
content: By extracting the signature out of the RLP encoded part, we can make it so you can verify the signature without having to decode and then encode.  If we are going to do that anyway, SSZ seems like a good choice because it can either be treated as SSZ *or* it can be treated as just 4 fixed size values concatenated followed by a dynamic sized value (which can be extracted without any specialized decoder if desired).

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, so we would take a legacy raw transaction (either from a third party signer or during pending pool upgrade at fork block) of the form `rlp(nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, v, r, s)` and convert it into either type 0 transaction or type 1 transaction depending on the value of `v`.  We would then have either a type 0 or type 1 eip-2718 transaction that gets gossiped over devp2p or included in a block.

author: sky.cactus
content: The type 0/1 transactions are simpler to validate and process than legacy transactions because we get rid of all of that baggage/complexity from eip-155, and we get rid of the need to decode/encode in order to validate the signature when processing a block or processing a devp2p message.

author: sky.cactus
content: My belief is that overall, client complexity will decrease slightly with this change as clients can move all of the EIP-155 and decode/encode complexity out to the edges (e.g., JSON-RPC layer).

author: sky.cactus
content:
Signing today goes like:
```js
to_be_signed = rlp(nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, chainId, 0, 0)
// or: to_be_signed = rlp(nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data)
yParity, r, s = secp256k1(to_be_signed)
v = yParity + chainId * 2 + 32
// or: v = yParity + 27
raw_transaction = rlp(nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, v, r, s)
```
